support_summary: NGLY1 physically binds the ATXN3c isoform (MS and Co-IP evidence)

functions.cellular_process: Deglycosylation of misfolded glycoproteins prior to proteasomal degradation in the ERAD pathway.
functions.effect_description: ATXN3c interacts with NGLY1 to facilitate the processing and degradation of glycosylated ERAD substrates at the ER membrane.
biological_consequence: ATXN3c (C-terminal tail) → ER membrane localization → Recruits NGLY1 to the ERAD machinery → Facilitates deglycosylation of misfolded glycoproteins (removal of N-glycans) → Enables substrate threading into the proteasome → Promotes efficient ERAD and reduces ER stress.
specific_effects: Isoform-specific binding via the C-terminal hydrophobic tail of ATXN3c
Recruitment of NGLY1 to the ER membrane
Proposed facilitation of glycosylated substrate clearance

evidence.paper_title: Physiological and pathophysiological characteristics of ataxin-3 isoforms
evidence.relevant_quote: ATXN3c specifically interacts with NGLY1 and UBR2... both involved in the ERAD pathway... our results suggest that ATXN3c might be involved in the degradation of glycosylated proteins.

mechanism_correction: The interaction is specific to the ATXN3c isoform, which contains a unique hydrophobic C-terminal tail (replacing the third UIM). ATXN3c recruits NGLY1 to the ER membrane to coordinate the deglycosylation of misfolded glycoproteins during ER-associated degradation (ERAD).
mechanism: Deglycosylation of misfolded glycoproteins prior to proteasomal degradation in the ERAD pathway.
effect: ATXN3c interacts with NGLY1 to facilitate the processing and degradation of glycosylated ERAD substrates at the ER membrane.
summary: ATXN3 activates NGLY1 to modulate erad coordination of glycosylated proteins, ultimately affecting promotes efficient erad and reduces er stress.
